attributes.action: We the taxpayer call upon the government to cut benefits that MP's make use of
attributes.additional_details:
Members of Parliament (MPs) are elected to serve the interests of their constituents.
However, it is concerning to see them cutting benefits for the vulnerable individuals who helped elect them. Before implementing such cuts, MPs should consider leading by example and reducing the benefits they receive due to their positions."
attributes.background: MP's are supposed to work for the people who voted for them, but are cutting benefits of the poor who voted them into power. We find before MP's make these they should make cuts to their own compensation and benefits in the light of their proposed cuts to save on benefits to poor people

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a review of MP’s expenses:

Review the system of expenses and allowances for MPs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/702821
